info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garfield and south central Rio Blanco Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, satellite data indicated a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Rifle, or 30 miles northwest of Glenwood Springs, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. Heavy rain is expected along with frequent lightning. SOURCE...Satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Garfield and south central Rio Blanco Counties, including the following locations... Rio Blanco. This includes Colorado 13 between mile markers 6 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
